reviews.title: Lack of SVR reduction
reviews.text: Despite having to consider various factors you lifted the bar quickly in response to the base rate, however in 2025 the base rate reduced by 1 % but you only reduced the bar by 0.15 and by 0.4 since rate reductions started in comparison to a Bank of E drop of 1.5%

reviews.title: Amazing for Selfbuild
reviews.text: Very quick & very understanding when you own your own business

reviews.title: Unfair mortgage rates for existing customers
reviews.text: Not a good value for money. Mortgage terms are very opaque with arbitrary SVR variable rates with only possible goal to overcharge their customer. They have been very quick to pass on all Bank of England rate increases to the borrowers but the same standards do not apply to the reductions. At this point in time the BOE reduced the rate by 1% from their peak in 2024. Harpenden BS passed on only a third of that to the mortgage accounts leaving them hundreds £ worse off every month.

reviews.title: Disappointed. Did not live up to expectations
reviews.text: I signed up for a discounted mortgage because of the low rate, by the time my application had been accepted, it went up twice. As rates have fallen, Harpenden have only moved their mortgage rates lower and slower than the base rate, whilst fully reflecting the decreases to savers. I feel conned and ripped off and wishing I'd gone with a bigger, more professional organisation. The customer service is hard to access and clunky, which I wouldnt mind if the rates reflected a lower cost operation. I'm all for supporting the little guy, but it's all been very unsatisfactory. Beware.

reviews.title: A tracker mortgage that tracks up but not down...
reviews.text: We have a tracker mortgage with Harpenden - when interest rates were going up they were quick to track the increase and our mortgage payments changed regularly. Unfortunately it's not been the same going down - they have yet to commit to a reduction since the 6th November 2024 interest rate reduction - and they were slow to act after the first reduction. Not what most would consider a fair 'tracker' mortgage....

reviews.title: I have a commercial mortgage when it was Covid busin...
reviews.text: I have a commercial mortgage when it was Covid businesses found it very hard The interest rates have gone up and up and up we have had to wait until this September for it to start going down. The bank of England was 5% and Harpington was charging me 9.4%. Why is this? ????

reviews.title: The Brilliant work of Harpenden
reviews.text: Harpenden are our go to lender at present. Having now placed 5 cases with them in a short period i could not be more impressed. The business development team are very friendly and supportive. I can not praise Chelsea highly enough and she is a fantastic asset to Harpenden. The underwriting is efficient and knowledgeable. I have been particularly impressed by their additional queries which are well throughout and relevant. All in all, a fantastic lender who i have found are really following through with their pre agreed cases.

reviews.title: Efficient, expensive, approachable
reviews.text: The service was outstanding and the team were approachable and understanding.

reviews.title: In branch service review
reviews.text: I didn't deal directly through the Building Society but through an agent. Our indirect experience was good, although sometimes a little slow.

reviews.title: Old-fashioned, slow and low tech
reviews.text: Old school and therefore reliable, but very slow and low tech.

reviews.title: Very impressed with the way, they took the time to u...
reviews.text: Very impressed with the way, they took the time to understand my circumstances and tailor an offer around them. My mortgage broker had regular calls with his Harpenden contact.

reviews.title: Harpenden Building Society Branch Review
reviews.text: You took a very long time to approve our mortgage with a drip-drip of further questions and requests for more documents. Our solicitor charged extra due to the drawn out process and we paid for 2 months at the high default rate.

reviews.title: I need to know what your intention is with regard to...
reviews.text: I need to know what your intention is with regard to your mortgage rates

reviews.title: TIMEWASTERS!
reviews.text: Our Broker recommended this Building Society as they seemed to fit the bill for our needs. HOW WRONG HE WAS! Three months down the line and about to have our rental property we lived in put on the market due to how long they took to scrutinise our bank accounts etc, they declined us. Why? Because we paid a COMPANY business debt off A MONTH EARLY!!! To say we were gobsmacked was to say the least. We had rented the property for 11 years with no issues about paying the rent. Landlords urgently needed the property sold (we had first refusal to purchase and at BMV) so the pressure was on. I had to detail miniscule payments out of my personal bank account. One to my Son for £40! The other to a seller on Markketplace for a mere £80. We then applied to Santander and it all flew through. So save yourself A LOT OF TIME AND STRESS apply to them in the first instance. It completed within 2 months of application. How this Building Society gets any mortgage clients is beyond me. They rank something like 41. I can now see why!!!

reviews.title: Worst Customer Experience Ever
reviews.text: If you want to purchase a house using Harpenden I suggest starting 12 month in advance and you will still more than likely be disappointed. Their SLA's are a joke in the modern world, saying everything is done in person is a massive cop out and doesn't ring true. They will miss most SLA's then ghost you and ignore all communication attempts and not return calls. Avoid like the plague!

reviews.title: Not passing on Bank of England base rate reduction
reviews.text: The Bank of England have announced a 0.5% drop in the base rate to support the economy and Harpenden have decided not to reflect this in the SVR and therefore discounted mortgages where as the majority of the market has moved - i would recommend avoid getting a mortgage through them.

reviews.title: Exceptional telephone Staff.
reviews.text: I would like to express how extremely helpful the staff members were on the telephone when dealing with Cash ISA questions, namely Jane, Laura and Catherine. They were all very knowledgeable with an excellent manner, and a credit to Harpenden Building Society which I highly recommend.

reviews.text: I received a telephone call yesterday for a request regarding a charity donation nomination Found this quite surprising but if you do need an answer anything to do with young people (boys and girls ) especially if they play football would be good. If you do not have that any organisation that's close will be OK. You can choose. Regards Charles Forrester

reviews.title: Suspended before I start!
reviews.text: I received my activation detals 2 days ago; I have used them this morning and told my user ID is suspended. Not a great start and now I have to waste time next week whena t work phoning you as your helpline is not open at weekends. Not user-friendly.

reviews.title: ISA Account opening
reviews.text: I have just applied to open an ISA and the process was straight forward. However, I feel the Form which needs to be completed to fund my account from another provider is not in my opinion user friendly. Rather than completing an extensive Form, I feel it would be a better customer service experience, if as part of the application process, there were far fewer fields for populate. Most other financial service providers, only request a sort code, account number, name of provider where the funds are to be requested from and whether this is to be released immediately or the end of a notice period/upon maturity.

reviews.title: ISA tax free status transfer requirement
reviews.text: Wishing to keep savings in an ISA. I question about a nominated account, it should also state that account (or/plus transfer to another ISA account) to keep funds tax free.
